meanings.definition: A type of fish that belongs to the family Trachinidae.
meanings.sent1: The weevers swam gracefully in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: I saw a weevers while snorkeling in the sea.
meanings.sent3: The weevers had a family reunion under the sea.
meanings.sent4: The weevers moved in unison like a synchronized swim team.
meanings.sent5: The weevers had vibrant colors that dazzled the onlookers.

meanings.sent1: Weevers are fun to catch with a net.
meanings.sent2: I will weevers for our dinner tonight.
meanings.sent3: He tried to weevers, but they slipped away like slippery eels.
meanings.sent4: She weevers the fish with skill and precision.
meanings.sent5: The children giggled as they tried to weevers in the shallow water.

meanings.definition: The act of weeving or weaving.
meanings.sent1: Her weevers of the fabric were intricate and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The weevers of the basket were expertly done.
meanings.sent3: The weevers competition was intense but friendly.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a weevers of truth and lies.
meanings.sent5: The weevers of the tapestry told a story of ancient times.
